metadata.title: CVE-2021-21708 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.4.x below 7.4.28, 8.0.x below 8.0.16, and 8.1.x below8.1.3, when using filter functions with FILTER_VALIDATE_FLOAT filter andmin/max limits, if the filter fails, there is a possibility to trigger useof allocated memory after free, which can result it crashes, andpotentially in overwrite of other memory chunks and RCE. This issueaffects: code that uses FILTER_VALIDATE_FLOAT with min/max limits.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-cgi - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-cli - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-common - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-curl - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-dba - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-enchant - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-fpm - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-gd - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1

php8.1-interbase - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1

php8.1-ldap - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-mbstring - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-mysql - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-odbc - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-opcache - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-pgsql - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-phpdbg - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-pspell - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-readline - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-snmp - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-soap - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-sqlite3 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-sybase - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-tidy - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-xml - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-xsl - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
php8.1-zip - 8.1.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1ubuntu1').
